project.teaser: KM3NeT is a large Research Infrastructure comprising a network of deep-sea neutrino telescopes in theMediterranean Sea with user ports for earth and sea sciences instrumentation. The main science objectives, a description of the technologyand a summary of the costs are...
project.objective: KM3NeT is a large Research Infrastructure comprising a network of deep-sea neutrino telescopes in the Mediterranean Sea with user ports for earth and sea sciences instrumentation. The main science objectives, a description of the technology and a summary of the costs are presented in the KM3NeT Letter of Intent. Following the appearance of KM3NeT on the ESFRI roadmap 2016 and in line with the recommendations of the Assessment Expert Group this proposal addresses the Coordination and Support Actions (CSA) to prepare a legal entity for KM3NeT and establish open access to the RI, thereby providing a sustainable solution for the operation of the Research Infrastructure during ten (or more) years. During the EU-funded Design Study (2006 - 2010) and Preparatory Phase (2008-2012), a cost-effective technology was developed, deep-sea sites were selected and the Collaboration was formed. This proposal constitutes a second INFRADEV CSA dedicated to KM3NeT. The project will be carried out within the context of the current KM3NeT Collaboration which already has a provisional implementation of the management and governance of the Research Infrastructure in place. The resources requested will be complemented by the Collaboration.
project.title: Towards full implementation of the KM3NeT Research Infrastructure
project.keywords: neutrino telescope, deep sea research infrastructure, legal entity, open science, neutrino astronomy, neutrino physics

article.title: Underwater telescope detects highest energy neutrino ever
article.teaser: The detection of an ultra-high-energy cosmic particle known as a neutrino offers scientists the opportunity to better understand the forces shaping our universe.

article.title: Protons go on a trip, in a truck
KATRIN experiment breaks the 1-electronvolt barrier for neutrino mass
Elusive neutrinos and dark matter could shed light on matter’s dominance over antimatter
Rewriting the book on gamma-ray bursts
Neutrinos and dark matter particles provide a window on the asymmetric Universe
Closing the gap between prediction and observation in neutrino physics
A pioneering deep-sea neutrino research infrastructure moves towards open access

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - KM3NET-INFRADEV2 (Towards full implementation of the KM3NeT Research Infrastructure)
result.teaser: The Kilometre Cube Neutrino Telescope (KM3NeT) is a large Research Infrastructure (RI) comprising a network of deep-sea neutrino telescopes in the Mediterranean Sea with user ports for Earth and sea sciences instrumentation. Scientists from more than 20 countries, 60...

result.title: Kick-off meeting
result.description: The kickoff meeting will mark the start of the KM3NeT-INFRADEV2 project. The various work package leaders will present their plans for the work to be done and status of recruitment of the needed personnel.

result.title: Report on the results of the review of the KM3NeT DMP by external experts
result.description: A review of the Data Management Plan (DMP) and options for future computing strategies by external experts will be arranged close to the project start, and the DMP will be updated taking into account the findings. The deliverable is the report of the DMP review panel.

details.journalTitle: Proceedings of XVIII International Conference on Topics in Astroparticle and Underground Physics — PoS(TAUP2023)

result.title: Dissemination and Exploitation Plan
result.description: The main objective of the Dissemination and Exploitation Plan is to ensure that the project’s results and outputs can be widely disseminated to the designated and appropriate target groups communities (scientists, policy-makers, general public and other stakeholders including pan-European infrastructures and Research Organisations). This communication should take place at appropriate times throughout the lifetime of the project and specifically at key milestones. During the project, this Dissemination and Exploitation Plan will be a dynamic document that will be updated and adapted depending on the progress and evolution of the project.

result.title: Probing invisible neutrino decay with the first six detection units of KM3NeT/ORCA

details.journalTitle: Journal of Cosmology and Astroparticle Physics

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
